Title: Object: The preliminaries of peace.
Description: Bonaparte (left), not caricatured, stoops with bared posterior, which Addington, in profile to the left, kneels to kiss. Bonaparte is in uniform, with a plumed cocked hat; under his left arm is a large sabre, in his right hand a paper: 'Mem, the grand design haveing failed in Egypt agree to Peace Item to get back all and give up none'. Addington wears his Speaker's wig and robes; his back is oddly and abjectly curved. Behind him and on the extreme right. John Bull stands full face, holding his hat and scratching his head with a perplexed grin. He is very fat and wears a striped waistcoat, plain coat, and breeches. He says: "Oddzooks if this is the beginning, what will be the finish, of the Business". In the background (left) five men dance round a Liberty Tree, a pole surmounted by bonnet rouge wreathed with laurel (cf. BMSat 9214, &c); they wave their bonnets rouges in ecstasy. 3 November 1801 Hand-coloured etching
Curator's comments: (Description and comment from M.Dorothy George, 'Catalogue of Political and Personal Satires in the British Museum', VIII, 1947) See BMSat 9726, &c. News of Abercromby's victory at Alexandria on 30 Aug and the forthcoming evacuation of Egypt, reached London on 2 Oct., tne day after the signing of the Preliminaries. The official dispatch arrived only on 21 Nov.; Bonaparte ordered Otto to insist on signature before 2 Oct.as an alternative to war. 'Camb. Hist. of Br. Foreign Policy', i. 305. Listed by Broadley.
Bibliographic references: BM Satires / Catalogue of Political and Personal Satires in the Department of Prints and Drawings in the British Museum (9736)
Associated names: Associated with: Henry Addington, 1st Viscount Sidmouth
Associated with: Napoléon I, Emperor of the French (Napoleon)
